alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; St. Louis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:51AM CDT until March 30 at 2:17PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the Meramec River in Missouri... near Steelville near Eureka at Pacific at Valley Park at Fenton at Arnold. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meramec River near Eureka. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, The lowest house on West Spring River Ranch Road begins flooding on the lower level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 28.3 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Meramec River Eureka 19.0 10.9 17.6 23.5 28.3 26.1 19.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
